page.title: 18SHOPS
page.content: AT ONE TIME THE ONLY SHOP WAS A SMALL ONE ON NORTH ROAD. IT WAS RUN BY A LADY CALLED MISS HALL WHO SOLD TREACLE IN A BARREL OUTSIDE THE SHOP. MISS HALL LATER BECAME A SCHOOL TEACHER AT HOLME SCHOOL. THE FIRST CO_OPERATIVE SHOP WAS SET UP BY MR ERNEST COLLINSON AND MR EVERARD PRILL WHO WENT TO CARNFORTH TO SEE IF THEY COULD START A CO_OPERATIVE SHOP UP BECAUSE PEOPLE WERE COMPLAINING ABOUT THE LACK OF FACILTIES IN HOLME. LATER ON THERE WAS A TRAVELLING BAKER WHO CAME TO THE VILLAGE. ON THE FIRST VISIT TO THE VILLAGE ALL THE CHILDREN CAME OUT OF SCHOOL AND THEY WERE ALL GIVEN A LOAF OF BREAD TO TAKE HOME.THE CO_OP HAS NOW CLOSED AND WE HAVE JUST GOT A SPAR GROCERS,A POST OFFICE,A HAIRDRESSERS AND A CYCLE SHOWROOM.
